reviews.text:
Outrageously good sandwiches. We’ve tried countless options from the menu now, and we haven’t been disappointed by a single one. My all-time favorite is the Fat Molly. What’s particularly impressive is their willingness to accommodate dietary needs. I can’t eat bread, so they put the entire contents of the sandwich very neatly and carefully packaged in an aluminum tray to keep it hot. Excellent.

This is our favorite sandwich shop in the area, and we always make sure to have our out-of-town guests try it!

Had a delicious meal outside in the nice autumn air with their open aired bar seated area. Service was minimal, only one person for the whole bar area. Overall it was good! And it supports a good cause.

﻿
When I see the word “gourmet” used in marketing/advertising descriptions of pizza I expect a flavor jamboree which was not the case for the pepperoni and mushroom pizza I was served at Lost Dog Cafe. Old Dominion Pizza in Arlington is my taste benchmark standard for excellent pizza in NOVA in my taste opinion. LDC pizza dough was totally bland and uninteresting compared to ODP’s flavorful corn meal dough. LDC toppings also lacked strong flavor profile by comparison. Using the word “gourmet” indicates to me farm fresh, locally sourced ingredients. I would be stunned if LDC verified that.

LDC beer selection is commendable. I appreciate that LDC has bottle Pilsner Urquell which is reason enough to come back. Would be a nice touch if they had Pilsner glasses. Carrot Cake icing was a bit cloying but saved by distinctly flavorful fresh black walnuts and fresh raisins in the cake. My guess as to $7.95 (let’s call it 8 bucks) a slice price. Coffee was pretty good with it.

The staff was friendly, welcoming, helpful and attentive. Could not ask for better in that department. I like the light color wood square bar design having 5 bar stools with backs on 3 sides of the square. The cafe is exceptionally clean. Their pizza box should win a design award for its solid construction and the Lost Dog logo that covers the box top and includes QR code. I hope they find their dog.

Pizza = 1 star

Carrot Cake = 3 1/2 stars

The rest of the package = 5 stars

Pizza really drags down the overall to 3 stars. I am compelled to give heavy weight to the pizza component because of the loud marketing/advertising that it is “gourmet” which, in my opinion, it is not.
Do you like Pizza?  Sandwiches?  Salads?  Pasta?  They have a huge variety.  Indoor and   outdoor seating.   The restaurant sits on a quiet corner but is worth the hunt.  You won't be disappointed.

Dog collars (BAKED onion rings) got missed in the recent menu printing but know they are still there. My favorite sandwich is the Big Dog (they had me at 2 cheeses and garlic mayo). I am told they roast their own meats and it certainly tastes like the real deal!  I also liked that I could try a 5 oz. of a hard cider. Yum! This location was new to us and it didn't disappoint. Free garage parking conveniently located nearby.

There’s plenty of free parking available via the garages in the area and street parking. The restaurant has indoor and outdoor seating available. Service was fast. Overall the main entrees were good but also sweet in flavor. Decent portions were given. The fresh garden rolls with shrimp and pork were flavorless but it’s lettuce and meat wrapped in rice paper.

We sat on the patio and there was dedicated staff, so we had very attentive service.
The menu was fairly extensive. The fried spring rolls were quite good, I've never had them fried before. Our mains came quickly and were hot and delicious. Flan was a surprising dessert option but was well done.

Slightly disappointed with my experience here - there is very little service (you have to go up and order - I think the restaurant is shortstaffed). I went on a weekend evening so it was pretty busy, but I did not have to make a reservation for a party of three.

The main issue was my food. I got lemongrass chicken, and it was dry and not seasoned well. The portion sizes were large, but I honestly expected better from a well-renowned restaurant like Four Sisters.

My friend got lemongrass beef which was miles better than my chicken - how is there such a large disparity between two similar items on the menu?

Pricing was pretty fair for the portion size, but not for the quality. I probably will not be back. I'm sure that some of the items on the menu are good (like the lemongrass beef), but I am simply disappointed with what I got

Such a great Authentic Vietnamese Cuisine that you could find. We love the food and the service very much. The atmosphere in this restaurant is quite pleasant and relaxed. Whenever there is a chance to enjoy here, it is a good experience. Great value for money. We recommend this.

I had the veggie egg rolls which was served on noodles and salad. The egg rolls were delicious but the noodles and salad lacked flavor and I didn't like the sauce it came with. The floor of the restaurant and the table were a little sticky like it hadn't been thoroughly cleaned. The atmosphere was good in that I was there for a book club meetup and we had a nice quiet table by ourselves in a corner. This restaurant worked well for this purpose. Service was pretty good although since we were off in a corner it was hard to get the server's attention and she didn't check on us as frequently as would be ideal.

There is no parking on site but there is a free parking garage right across the street.

Usually I don't write a review so quickly but this is worth saying: Saturday March 7 around 7pm. The one employee working was the nicest and most helpful person I've encountered all year (all restaurants). I told him I was new to JJ. He gave me the basics and suggestions. Then made a freaky fast #9. Shouldn't be hard to figure out his name. Promote that guy or give him an award. A day off with pay. Something 👍👍👍
Food was delicious and didn't wait long,and service was great.

I placed an order for delivery because my mom had a stroke and I have to stay at Inova Fairfax hospital with her. They called me to tell my the driver was out and it would be “30 minutes” after 45 minutes I called back and they said the driver was 5 minutes away, 15 minutes later I call and he’s “still not here.” Jimmy johns is supposed to be fast. Why would it take a driver over an hour to deliver food. Hire more people and stop lying to your customers. I ordered here almost every day while I was at the hospital and my mom is staying another week. They won’t be getting my business any more.
My favorite Jimmy John’s location. The vegetables are always fresh and crisp, the employees are always in a good mood, and the drivers go above and beyond. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

After coming to this location twice, i’ve come to the conclusion that they intentionally make the sandwiches bad so that you don’t return. Hire more people or something but the current staff is rude, dismissive, and each time i’ve visited there is enough mayo for five sandwiches slapped on, it’s to the point where its not even edible. Worst Jimmy Johns I have EVER been to.

It’s was my first time eating here and it was a tasty lunch. My friend likes this place so my other friend and I went here for brunch/lunch. Friendly staff and a clean bathroom minus the paper towel on the bathroom floor. The food - I believe everyone enjoyed their meals with no issues. I got an apple salad with shrimp and I loved the decent sized shrimp that came with my meal. My friend is apart of the matchbox rewards program which allowed her to build up her points with today’s lunch/brunch. I guess if you frequent this restaurant enough, why not sign up and get rewarded for the meals/drinks purchased. Overall, I would recommend this place to eat a meal.

The wait staff was wonderful. BUT.
I haven't been here since before the pandemic. My bf wanted pizza so I was excited to come to the Mosaic District and get the honey glazed prosciutto and arugula pizza. Unfortunately, they changed the recipe and it now has some kind of white cheese on it, and instead of prosciutto, the meat had the consistency of bacon. Either that or it was way overcooked. Not at all what I was expecting. It was terrible to be honest. The replacement veggie pizza was just as bad, slathered in pesto and zero flavor. And my bf pizza had a million pepperonis on it, but it was half burnt. All in all, for $60 (including a $14 key lime cocktail) it was not enjoyable. As I recall, this was a pizza place. Now it's just like any other variety restaurant.

Wait staff is awesome attentive and polite. The atmosphere is good and the music is always good. The food has a serenade with your taste buds. I had the ginormous meatball(beef, veal, pork, pepperoni sauce)w/a beautiful piece of bread. It was the perfect 👌🏾 selection for lunch. This meal , that matchbox has listed as a starter; was so fulfilling and delectable. I ordered(to go) the mambo chicken pizza. I’ll be back for more on the menu. Until next time matchbox!!

I'm not used to having poor quality service at this location. Let alone any store from this chain. My visit this occasion was for a birthday. Our waitress seemed confused and often struggled to remember items. We decided to give her multiple chances being that it's a pandemic and food services are strained. Nonetheless, simple things like drinks and questions about basic things on the menu just caused such a challenge. My guest all ordered selections between pizza or seafood entrees. My suggestion to those of you reading my review. Wait until the summer, those are my fondest and best experiences with this chain location.

The food and service are like the star rating: mid. Predictable, overly-salted/fried food and slow service. It’s a good place if you don’t want to wait in busy Mosaic and you just want a quick meal - it also accommodates large parties well. It certainly isn’t a favorite of mine, but it’s somewhere we go for the convenience.

I sat at the indoor bar early on a Wednesday evening to get dinner close to a home to which I was going later. I can see how this place would be a great location at which I could watch a game and have some elevated bar food. The outdoor bar sounded a bit crowded and loud with the live musician, so I found the clean inside bar more appealing. Service was pleasantly attentive.

I ordered a Ruby mule from the drink list, chicken fingers with regular fries, and blackened salmon with a side of sweet potato fries. The drink was mixed well with a balanced taste. The chicken fingers were thermally hot and well seasoned with a crispy coating. The fries came in a good portion and arrived hot and seasoned. The salmon was cooked medium to medium rare as requested, although I did not sense much blackened flavor. The garnish was portioned well and complimented the fish well. The sweet potato fries arrived seasoned, hot, and as crisp as could be.

My meal totaled just under $60 excluding tax and tip and proved to be a satisfying value for the quality of the food I ate. I would definitely return and try burgers, sandwiches, or maybe other entrees when I did.

Our office and family’s go-to place for burgers, lunches and yummy appetizers.

You’ll first be greeted with friendly staff, served freshly made popcorn to satisfy your tastebuds while you look at your menu for drinks and meal.

We enjoy both outdoor patio that is covered and indoor seating that feels warm.

It was late (after 8pm) and being that most of the restaurants around closes at 9, we decided to give this place a try.

We were seated as the place were not buat at all at that hour on Wednesday night. Our server got us the menu and water.  Everything looked great and we have high hopes because they shared the same kitchen with the fine dining restaurant next door which also by the same owner.

We settled on jambalaya, Pei mussels and Korean sauced wings.  The food took a bit of waiting for some reason considering we were the 1 of only 2 groups in the restaurant at that time.

It was worth the wait when the food came. The jambalaya wasn't the typical one that we know even though the ingredients are about the same with the use of andouille sausage, chicken and seafood. The use of basmati rice and cream sauce (seen it paired with pasta) were intriguing but was very tasty and satisfying.

The Pei mussels also had the cream sauce which was another great addition but the portion was a lot bigger than what had in other restaurants. The soft chewy and hard crusty bread paired well with this dish.

The wings were great but we were so full it went into a box.

We will be bringing a few friends over next time.

It was little disappointing.
It's got nice atmosphere for beer but the wings i ordered wasn't as good as I thought. I got half hikory honey mustard and half bbq. I don't think it's the sauce but the chicken itself didn't have much to eat and the meat was very rough to eat. The burger was good.

Me and my friend dined here on a Monday night. It wasn't busy at all, it was a Monday night....

The service was EXCELLENT. Blake our server was attentive but didn't hover. My friend ordered Decaf coffee and he initially let us know that they didn't have any and offered her decaf tea. He left and came back a few minutes later, with a cup of coffee he had gotten from the restaurant next door. TALK ABOUT INITIATIVE! We were there catching up for about 4.5 hours and our waters were always refilled, never truly had to ask for anything...

The food was great, I got the fish tacos which were at market price, $18.00...at first I was like why? But they were some nicely sized fish filets in the tacos and it came with some cilantro rice which was good. I wasn't full but was satisfied which allowed room for dessert (pictured), Kentucky Butter Cake.

Bathrooms were clean and overall great experience, would definitely go there again!!

Always a Chipotle fan and will continue to be but this particular location is awful for many reasons. This location has a big problem with cleanliness. The tables, floors and bathrooms are always unclean. Worst of all, they don’t wear any hair net and always run out of guacamole. I ordered a bowl with steak and they literally ran out and weren’t gonna offer anything else as replacement. I kid you not, maybe 6 small pieces of steak in the bowl and if I didn’t say anything they would’ve sold it to me like that.

I’m not sure what time of training these employees get considering this location seems to have plenty of bad reviews but something definitely needs to change. The heavier spanish girl that makes the food itself on the line seem to have a attitude problem when customers are ordering. She also doesn’t pay attention at all when we ordered because she was to busy cracking jokes with her co workers in the back. Lots of these employees seem to not understand the difference between work and play, especially when there is a huge line. Took like 10 minutes just for 1 order and for another employee to show up and help her.

Very nice place to have a burrito, although the portion was somewhat too small in my opinion. I wish they had more drink options as well, more natural or organic drink options especially. Horchata would also make a good addition to the drink menu! Other than that, everything else was fine.

I bought garlic guajillo steak bowl and veggie bowl spent about $27 when I asked for one tortilla on the side this kid wouldn’t give it to me and said I had to pay .50 cents which never happen to me. I always get the same order with tortilla on the side no issues. I ended up walking out with no tortilla. You want to hire kids you should train them right.

While you wait for your dinner, everyone here is extremely polite and patient .. Since ordering here in the middle of 2022, everything has remained consistent for me and my family: the same portions of food (if there’s no food for us to choose we simply respect the choices there are left), seeing the service members work extremely hard to make us happy, and eventually receiving my orders in a respectful and constructive manner. Ever since going to this place, the employees have been working extremely hard to ensure that we are satisfied with our food.
There is so much happiness among the staff members who work here and give their all to making your meals delectable.

Because of how frequently I visit (I guess I'm a pretty loyal customer🤞), there is one employee with whom I oftenly engage in conversation. We always get along well, and they surprisingly remember my orders every time.

Just keep in mind that these employees put a lot of effort into making us customers happy; even though there are times when they do horse around or crack jokes, remember that they are still people like us and should be treated with respect just like how they treat you with respect about your orders ☺️☺️☺️

Always a Chipotle fan and will continue to be but this particular location is awful for many reasons. This location has a big problem with cleanliness. The tables, floors and bathrooms are always unclean. And worst of all, I have found multiple strands of hair in my food orders at least 3 times (continued to give them a chance though)! Furthermore, they always mess up the pick-up orders. I hope this cleanliness issue gets looked into asap.

About as American as it can get😉. Everything I imagined how an American diner looks like and feels like. First ever American diner I visited and boy oh boy, exactly how they show them in movies😜, even equipped with a working jukebox 🤓.Great ambiance, great pie and an overall just great food. Had a pancake, scrambled eggs and coffee and it was scrumptious 😋. The staff were also very friendly and very very helpful. They made sure I enjoyed every bit of my experience. I think maybe that’s why the place was so full. I totally recommend.

I met my friend for lunch. We had a nice comfortable booth not to far from the door. We had an attentive waitress named Strawberry. Our menu choice was the crab cake. It tasted OK, the crab was not chunk type and no veges or any other added ingredients besides the binder. But the price was fair and the fries and coleslaw were very good. Yes I will return.

It’s a diner. And then so much more! Grew up going here but the changes to the menu are so welcomed. I can’t believe I had a Vegan Eggs Benedict that was GOOD! If I had to compare the menu, I’d rank it with Busboys and Poets: a solid mix of familiar items with enough of a switch-up to keep you trying new things for a while. Service is delightful. We had the Just Eggs Benedict, my sister had the fried chicken sandwich and a side waffle. Simple and filling! Can’t wait to bring the rest of the fam here for a casual meal that’s bound to impress them!

Great experience at the Merrifield Falls Church Silver Diner location tonight.   Jade, our server, was awesome and the best Silver Diner server we've had and we go about 1-2x a month for the past few years.  She was friendly,  very attentive, and cared about our having "a great Silver Diner experience." Jade recommended the seasonal shrimp and watermelon radish salad, which was really good, and a honey mustard sauce for the sweet potato fries.  She noticed our cups were half empty/full and offered to refill it with hot water.  Jade, thanks for the great Silver Diner experience!

Amazing place to eat at! Amazing breakfast and lunch! Haven’t had dinner yet. Their milkshakes are one of the best milkshakes I had. Milkshakes are hands down a must order. Had a bison burger and was so awesome. Keny (server) was great

Fully found a HAIR (blonde which none of us are so it was definitely from the servers) as soon as we opened the bowl. The portions were also a joke. Filing a complaint for a refund since none of us felt comfortable eating HAIR FOOD but they are just terrible with customer service as well. This is by far the worst location avoid at all costs!!!!!!!!

My boyfriend and I order Cava from Mosaic District about once a week as we are huge fans. However, two nights ago we found a wheel of a toy car in one of our bowls… an actual toy car wheel attached to a metal rod. Thankfully we found it before it was swallowed or bitten down on, but again, this was a sharp metal rod with a WHEEL on it. Insane. We called the store to notify them and they wanted to assure us that nobody there had any toy cars there. This whole thing would be comical if it wasn’t potentially dangerous. We sent an email with photos to customer service and they offered us a refund. Not sure what else we should have expected, given the strangeness of the situation, but it is safe to say we will no longer be customers of Cava, certainly not the Mosaic location. Beware of weird objects in your food, or who knows what else!

Cava claims to offer unlimited toppings. Well… that might be true at other Cava locations, but this one at The Mosaic is anything but unlimited. Portions are smaller than other Cavas I’ve been to, and toppings at the store look almost empty. Also didn’t offer a slice of pita. Corporate should assess this location and retrain both employees and management on the Cava philosophy.

Excellent fresh food quality and fast friendly service. Generous portions. I’ve been a regular customer for several years. Welcoming friendly team led by an engaging and personable manager. One of my all time favorites. We’ll done CAVA team! Thank you.
Cava (right) vs Rasi (left). Rasi doesn’t scam you by giving you a quarter of a bowl and you’ll pay less.

Great hidden gem across from Dunn Loring Metro.  Fresh salad and sandwiches, hot & cold.  Soup in the winter.  I've tried a few things across the menu, but I have my favorites:  chicken veggie soup, turkey club, steak & cheese, crispy chicken cutlet sandwich.  Most sandwiches can get made as wraps.  I have been coming to this place for years, the food is consistently tasty & fresh, made before your eyes if you stay by the counter.

This place has remained open for takeout of breakfast and lunch during this COVID-19 fiasco.  Great folks that deserve our local support.

Definitely recommend!
Very nice selection of wraps, sandwiches, salads, and snacks.  Owners and employees are always friendly.  Weekly bibimbap special is great!
Good place

Digital (self) ordering, there was only two unit which one was out of order.
bathroom was like hordeolum.
food was great, onion soup and avocado sandwich.
3 out of 5 coffee dispenser were empty and one was out of order. only hot water was ok. The app works good.

Went to Merrifield Panera after an ultrasound at 8 months pregnant l. Ate one half of my sandwich and went to eat the other and found the full cheese wrapper. It made me sick to my stomach. One of the most careless things you could possibly do. Great way to have someone lose interest in a chain restaurant no matter the location. there weren’t many customers in at this time but even if there were this is pretty unacceptable. gave the review two stars simple for the location at strawberry lane park.

I ordered a Mediterranean warm bowl, hoping to have some nice arugula in there. When I picked up the order, there was a lot of yellow or mushy arugula. I asked the manager to replace it. The manager delivered a “fixed” one, with almost the same problem, except with less vegetables. The photo shows what’s in the “fixed” version. I don’t believe they cared. I gave up asking again.
Broccoli macaroni in bread bowl, delicious, though, we’d prefer the bread to be freshly baked or warmed at least.

We went there today 01.01.2023 with my 80 years old mom. She has a lot of food restrictions. They did everything to make something that she could eat and be happy. I appreciate the great customer service and care!

I am so sad that i could not give them a 0 star.
They are not professional and rude to customers.
(Especially, to people who is trying to buy sandwiches with coupons)
Today, I went this store and tried to buy a sandwich. However, the lady in the store gave me disrespectful attitude because she did not know how to put the coupon in the system. She said i dont know. its 17. So I told her i am not gonna buy a sandwich with 17 dollars (she put something wrong on the system and price was went up with no reason). she threw the sandwich into the garbage can while i was standing there.

They changed the menu and bumped up the price a little. I don't like it. I like the old menu. For example, they got rid of steak sandwich and introduced Philly's sandwich. The way the make it awful. They put onion and bell pepper on top of the meat and microwave them. Come on.
Nice place to eat for me , I've been eating subway for years , my favorite fast food restaurant.

This location used to take Subway coupons until today. According to staff, the management decided that they didn't like their customers not paying full price for ham and cheese on 8 lbs of bread. Let's hope they reverse this decision as I used to buy food for myself and fellow staff here but other sub shops are looking really great right now. Thanks for disrespecting loyal customers.

Worst Subway I’ve ever visited. The kid working has such an attitude. He insisted that we only purchase 2 sandwiches and once I asked for a third, he was so grumpy. I asked him if there was a problem and I just got attitude

The new Arby's Wagyu Steakhouse Burger is a SHOCKER!!!
There wasn't any Arby's in burk so I took a small trip to this Arby's to see what the hype was about. The cashier who attended us was very friendly and our food came out very quick.
The burger was DELICIOUS and definitely far better than any of the other fast food chains. I definitely recommend to ignore what social media says and try the burger and make sure to go large for their curly fries because they're so good.
Also, a little unknown secret is that there's a little bell that you can ring for great service.

My first time at this location..  restaurant is very clean and updated..

The crinkle fries were amazing..  I was a little disappointed with the Gryo..  the meat was cold..  I suggest you stick with the Roast Beef..

Staff was very courteous and friendly, thank you

The Prime Rib cheesesteak was false advertisement.. tasted horrible..  look at the photo of the ad and IRL

Smh
This is the beef in cheddar that I got from this location! Worse ever. I would recommend going to dollar tree and getting Ramen noodles before going here for free

Ordered a few sliders for takeout dinner last week. Place wasn't busy at all. While I can appreciate the food being made to order this is also supposed to be fast food. I waited 15 minutes for my order and then upon receiving my order it was incorrect. Didn't bother to tell them to correct it to wait another 15 minutes. Dining area was clean inside and manager was friendly but time to service for "fast food" was extremely slow.
Enjoyed my smoked brisket sandwich yesterday!  Pricey but so is everywhere else right now, it seems. Service was fast, both I'm placing order and picking up food.

Working near-by, there are numerous Restaurants that offer Burgers on their menu.
The burgers here at Burger 7 are budget friendly, packed full of flavor and quickly made.

If I had to compare overall rating, these would place just after Five Guys burgers. They're not as overly seasoned as Shake Shacks burgers, but definitely have flavor enough.

Also, it may be a minor notation, but these are actual Cheeseburgers, not Burgers with Cheese.

Highly recommended for everyone. I've already introduced Burger 7 to my Coworkers down at the Mosaic District and they love it.

I went to place an order and there was a heavy sign board (Gelato sign) that I accidentally touched it with my leg so it fall down on my foot .
It wasn’t fixed ,not even with one screw . I got injured and no one care . The cashier guy didn’t even say sorry or anything when he saw me almost crying from the pain, instead of that ask me if i am ready to order . I called the store manager Mohammed, first he said that is not possible to be fallen off by it self then he said sorry .
I don’t believe how careless they are , unprofessional and disrespectful.
Lackluster experience, not as good as the other burger 7 I've been too. The food was drab as was the service. Still ate it and somewhat enjoyed it, just was very underwhelming

Wanted to try. My wife and I are at Fairfax Hospital and I did a late night run to grab food. Show up at 1am as they advertise being open til 2am and the "open" signs are still on with two guys chilling inside but doors locked tight. Oh well.

Burger 7 gave me such hope but, unfortunately, I just wasn't impressed.

Walking in, B7 gives you the feeling of a classic burger joint. There's retro music playing over the speakers, cement floors, an open ceiling and the smell of frying patties filling the air. I had high hopes...

...until I walked up to the counter. First off, the cashier gave us the "stare down" from the moment we walked through the doors. I've worked as a cashier, so I know it can be a little awkward just hanging around while customers figure out what they want, but it really started to get excessive. Like he wouldn't stop looking at us and it was maddeningly uncomfortable. When we finally did order our meals, he was very curt. Not rude, but just not friendly.

Also, interestingly enough, we were asked to leave a tip after we ordered. This isn't super unusual, I suppose, but it felt odd at a burger joint where we literally weren't helped at all by the staff. Then again, we were made so uncomfortable by the staring cashier that we were too afraid of what was going to happen to us, or our food, if we refused to leave a tip. So I suppose it worked.

We took our seats and waited for our food to arrive, which took awhile and gave us the opportunity to look at the "burger joint" atmosphere a little more closely. First off, everything was kind of gross. I understand it's a burger joint, so things are going to be a bit greasy, but I don't know of anyone who likes to see ketchup stains on the table and pieces of bun underneath their feet.

I'll also mention that the sauce bin was pretty nasty (see the photo). Almost none of the bottles had tops on them and they were covered in old, crusty sauce. Who wants to touch that?

Finally, our pager buzzed and we went up to get our food. As we were taking our last tray, I kid you not, one of the employees farted audibly, then turned and laughed at us. So that was fun...

We began our meal and I braved the gross sauce bin and tried to pour some ketchup on my burger, only to find that the bottle was empty. Pleasant.

The food itself, honestly, wasn't that bad. The fries were cold, but the burgers weren't bad. Nothing to write home about, certainly, but okay.

Nevertheless, the experience at the restaurant was absolutely terrible and ruined our perception of it.

I'll also mention that we just about caught our deaths waiting for our food to arrive. It was a pretty chilly night, but the restaurant was so unbelievably cold, plus it just felt incredibly uninviting. I think we would have found more warmth eating our food in a cemetery.

Why only 4 stars? Should be 5 stars. This location tastes better than other halal guy locations in the dmv. Their chicken and beef here are excellent. The only i dont like is how their price seems to go up every year. Please put an end to it.
The gyros are very nice! I just wish that there were more and better drink options, maybe some all natural sodas and juices. It is worth coming here to try the gyros, though.

I love the Halal guys. The food is always hot fresh and delicious. And today at this location was no exception. Inside was spotlessly clean. They made my rice and chicken fresh right in front of me and threw in a couple extra white sauces when I asked. There is no bathroom inside this business. And they unfortunately don't have Halal Guys signature lemonades and iced tea. But still a great experience

The owner of this location should know about this. I came here on the Saturday after Thanksgiving for a lamb gyro sandwich. It was after 8pm and cold outside. I walk up to the door and it's locked (not even close to closing time). I saw a customer eating and he looked at me like I didn't know how to open the door. He then walked over to open it and he too realized it was locked. After several failed attempts, he then motioned over to one of the girls who hesitated to walk over and open it. Now several minutes have passed and I'm still out in the cold. She finally came over and didn't even apologize. In fact, she had an angry look on her face, probably because she actually had to do some work. Find another job if you don't like it. The owner should also find a different profession if he/she can't hire good workers. I will never be back to this location. It's no wonder it was so dead. The meat itself was poor quality and its no surprise based on who's handling the food. If you are looking for a good gyro sandwich in Vienna, go to DCG or elsewhere. Coming here was a mistake and they really shouldn't be in business there.

Park at the harris teeter garage next door which has a 2 hour limit for free. Chicken platter 🥙 is pretty good, i felt small is good enough for a person, try hummus side with some fresh pita its awesome. Warning ⚠️ If u want red sauce 🌶 its hot not just white people hot, its brown hot. Prices are decent, overall maintenance and cleanliness is fair.

name: District BBQ
vicinity: O Dunn loring metro, 2670 Avenir Place, Vienna

reviews.text: Great food and great staff. We got the Z Man and the chicken with waffle fries and potato salad and they were delicious. They sell also by pound which is great. I didn't see the whole menu so I post it. Everything on the menu is halal and the meat is wood smoked.

I really like the food here, at least what I tried. I tried the pulled pork sandwich, the pulled chicken sandwich, and the baked beans… and they were all very great. The only downside is that the drink options are very limited, there is nothing good as far as drinks go in my opinion. It would be great to see a few natural juice and soda options as well. I also did not see a recycling bin, just a trash can. Other than that, all else was good.

I tried the chicken and slaw here and let me tell you, it has an amazing “juciosity” and memorable seasoning.  I also had some of the best service in my life from Gygy; she has such amazing warm hospitality.  I’ll most definitely be back to try the brisket and to spend some more time here. Thank you, Gygy, and your crew!

Great good! We ordered the sliced brisket, cowboy sandwich, and mac & cheese for the kid. Very tasty, definitely one of the best bbq places in the DMV Area!!!! As the side, we ordered fries, which was surprisingly yummy 😃😃👍👍

All menu are halal, no more pork menu.

We were craving district BBQ, so decided to stop by for lunch. I didn't know they started selling Peruvian style chicken and halal meat now. Tried them out and it was surprisingly good.
Meat was so tender and juicy. I love the rice, it reminds of my family fried rice. The whole combo was so cheap tooo- 5.99. Will come back for more!
* didn't realize they have waffle fries now, def will get next time

This location stands out from others.  Clean facility, very friendly staff.  I tried the egg bites which were actually better than I was expecting since they are just warmed up. Enjoyed my caramel latte as well.

I stopped here every day during a work trip. On day 2, the barista remembered my order from the day before and by day 3, they had remembered my name, too. Usually Starbucks feels like a corporate/not so personal place, but this one is filled with really warm and welcoming staff. They all deserve a raise :)

Simply one of the best Starbucks I've been to. Friendly and welcoming staff, clean environment, and excellent drinks done in no time.
A great way to start your day.

Thank you Dunn Loring team!
Everyone is so friendly!! 100% nicest Starbucks I’ve ever been to staff wise! I got a hundred good mornings and smiling faces! You guys are awesome!

The team at this location is so amazing! They welcome everyone, most by name. They have a nice system and even when super busy everything comes out so fast. They are hard working, the store is always clean, organized and friendly!!!

My first time eating at Jersey Mike's and it was so so. The employees definitely acted like they were from New Jersey and not the most welcoming especially while sitting in the restaurant. Bad Vibes! I ordered the Philly cheese steak sandwich and it was on very good bread, however, the steak tasted funny. If I get sick, I can reference my review. Overrated. I'm glad that I lived in Philly so I can compare taste. I'm good!

The sub itself is great and you can’t go wrong with a Jersey Mike’s meal. However the staff was rude and disrespectful. Some of them talk to you with attitude and give off the vibe that you as the customer are annoying them. Maybe they had a bad day or didn’t make great bread that day but doesn’t mean you need to treat people with disrespect. Don’t let my review prevent you from going to this location, you will get a good sub no matter what the mood of the employees are.
Excellent food. Employees are extremely nice. As a customer and as a third party delivery driver it's always a pleasure to come there.

First visit to this franchise. Very good cheese steak, equal to many I  had in the north philly area.
I'm figuring  an excuse to go back-- just a 2 week later edit. Had the Italian cold sub and it was wonderful. Best of all the lunch hour crew was very competent, and extremely polite and helpful. The operator of this franchise(?) has a true gem in this staff good food good staff makes happy customers
The girl who was making my turkey sub , she had a very long hair , and it was on the able while she was making food
Super good food and delicious smoothies. Tried the new Santa Fe Dilla

I have officially become a regular. Most of the staff know my order now and some know me by name. I have become a regular because the Bahama Mama  and ham on 9 grain bread are killer. Smoothy and sandwich are always perfectly made and terrific flavor. All ingredients are high quality, fresh and you can tell they are made with care. The space is well designed, visually interesting and clean. Staff seem genuinely happy working there and they generously put up with my eccentricities. The spot has duende.

First, tropical smoothie as a chain is delicious. Decent food, great smoothies.

Second, a note on this particular store. Management should be very proud of their business and especially their staff. They are the textbook definition of efficiency. They are well trained and seem happy to work there. Every time I walk in, my drink is already made and I'm greeted with smiling faces. This is not the case at all tropical smoothie stores but Dunn Loring nails it every time.
I love the food, the staff, and the smoothies. Clean facility. Consistently quick service and accurate orders.
Beautiful customer service and delicious smoothie

Stopped in for lunch to grab a bite to eat. The place needed to be cleaned and the drink counter needed to be serviced. The variety of food was good however is was good not great. The staff okay. Overall it was quick and good.

Good pieces of food and good prices too.
There are so many tables. Some beverages from the machine are out of service for a long time.
The salmon is better than the tuna and the service is really fast.
Food was quite good but the chicken was a bit salty. There was only one person working the cashier and the food so it took a minute but it was worth it

I must admit, good, fast Japanese food is hard to find in Northern Virginia and I'm just not sure Quickway has nailed it.

Went here on a Sunday evening for dinner and, upon walking in, the restaurant's open, industrial atmosphere feels a lot like a Chipotle. We were the only patrons in the building so we were able to walk up to the counter and immediately order.

I got the beef hibachi with noodles which set me back a little over $7. Not a bad price.

The food took about 10 minutes to make. They cook everything to order and all the food comes out piping hot, which I thought was cool.

Unfortunately, the meal just wasn't that good. It was okay...but certainly didn't knock me out of my chair. It was just bland. Pretty disappointing because the pictures on the menu looked so good.

I'll also say that I wasn't impressed with the staff. The cashier who took our orders was nice and did a good job, but the man running the grill looked disgruntled and spent any off-minutes he had on his phone. I don't really care that much, but it just felt a little unprofessional.

In the end, I don't think Quickway is going to be my go-to Japanese restaurant. My journey continues...
First customer of the day. Place was open and clean. Food was fresh, plentiful and delicious.

Food was horrible. I don't know why this place has such good reviews but in my experience, it deserves 0 star.

I was not welcomed to come in. The staffs were busy hanging out. I was the only guest but my food took forever to come out. Everything was so cold all the ingredients weren't heated up.
The burrito and tacos lack of flavor. So bland. Tastes nothing. They just put a lot of white rice so the burrito looks big but they chopped the fajitas so small it's almost invisible.

My first and the last visit here. Strongly not recommend.

We stopped here during our visit to Virginia and it was WELL WORTH the stop. The tacos and burrito were delicious. I do wish they offered the specialty beverages that we have had previously. But overall, will definitely come back during our next trip to Virginia!
Officially my favorite spot for burrito bowls (at least)! It’s amazing how consistent this restaurant is of all the years I’ve been here. I highly recommend getting their chicken.

This is our always go to place when we are in fairfax. We had the fish taco and amazing fresh bowl just after finishing our appointment at nearby place. Loved the ambience here. Customer service was decent too.
My orders were disappointing! The fried vegetables were burnt, as well as the chicken and fish! My bowl was full of carbon!  I give 2 stars since I had better meals here!
